definition: to show your face in public (derog.)
to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
surname Lu
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: First, we have to suppose that she was out to make money.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我们得假定她抛头露面是为了赚钱。

sentences.english: I should be ashamed to show my face in public.
Then she blamed me for standing out on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 邵说，“之后，她又指责我在互联网上抛头露面。”

sentences.english: I wish I was special, so fucking special…
sentences.chinese: 俺们也是勉为其难，谁愿意抛头露面招人嫌呢？

sentences.english: He had been open and aboveboard , and there was nothing to fear.
sentences.chinese: 他一向是抛头露面，公开活动的，这没什么害怕的。

sentences.english: In the past, people considered women who appear in public to be lacking in virtue.
sentences.chinese: 在过去，人们认为喜欢抛头露面的妇女是不守妇道的。

sentences.english: She is very shy. She doesn't like to show her face.
sentences.chinese: 她非常怕羞，她不喜欢抛头露面。
